website_summaries.verdict: Good for light work around the home and garden. Not a contractor saw.
pros: Same battery as other Porter Cable cordless tools

customer_reviews.title: like all tool manufacturers
customer_reviews.text: This little saw sure surprised me. I did not expect it to work nearly as well as it does. Of course, like all tool manufacturers, the saw came with a $2 blade (because they ran out of the $1 ones :). Get yourself a good blade and this little thing will cut. I even cut some white oak with it... and this applies to the entire Porter Cable 20V lithium line. I have the drill, jig saw, circular saw, and the multi-tool. All are great. With the drill, I can compare the PC to Makita and Milwaukee, since I also have recent versions of those. The PC is a little less expensive but works just as well as the others.
customer_reviews.author: southernstranger

customer_reviews.title: Super fun and easy to use, get a blade with a few more teeth (24) for cleaner cuts and you're solid.
customer_reviews.text: Man this makes jobs around the house so much easier. I helped my kids build a fort out front out of left over lumber and pallets and man this saw made it easier and more convenient that pulling out an extension cord etc. The 18 tooth blade is not a clean cutter. I ended up buying a DW 24 tooth thin kerf blade blade and man, what a difference. I also use an off brand 20v battery that is bigger than the ones that came w/ my drill.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: good for a homeowner
customer_reviews.text: This saw did what I needed for building a deck. Cut plenty of 2x lumber and decking boards. Not super powerful though and battery life is so-so. I would say it is great for a homeowner with projects, large and small. Might not be powerful enough for the professional who uses it all/every day. Update. The saw died after less than 8 months of light duty homeowner usage. I do not recommend this saw, and reduced the rating from 4 stars to 1 star. I may give back a star if Porter Cable replaces it under warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Eric S.

customer_reviews.title: Bad wobble !!!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one they have a bad wobble in the gear drive
customer_reviews.author: jas

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: Way under powered. I have it hooked up to one of the larger 20v batteries thinking that a porter cable slim battery was the problem. Still has trouble cutting through a 2 x 4. Also the guide does not line up at all. I had an old 18v Ryobi that worked much better.
customer_reviews.author: Cooder

customer_reviews.title: Worked great
customer_reviews.text: I just used this to re purpose an under bed drawer into a new entertainment unit, and overall I am quite happy with it. A few small issues though. The notch to line up the blade to your mark is slightly off, maybe 1/16". The flimsy plastic guard easily allows larger debris to wedge in between it and the blade, jamming the unit. And it goes through the Porter Cable batteries (both small and large) fairly quickly. Despite these small issues, it does work rather well, it cut through all the materials with no issues, and the stock blade it comes with does the job. I've always been happy with Portal Cable tools, it's their batteries that are junk.
customer_reviews.author: Tom S.

customer_reviews.title: Does a great job
customer_reviews.text: Does a great job, cuts very smoothly and clean cuts even at the end of the stroke. I bought this because I already had a battery drill and charger from the same brand.
customer_reviews.author: Thierry

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price, lightweight
customer_reviews.text: I abuse this thing - I use it primarily to cut down scrap lumber, break down pallets etc. so I can haul them to the dump. Also used when I need a light circular saw (say cutting a rafter tail while standing on a ladder). This saw clearly has less power than my corded saws but with a thin kerf blade it does just fine if kept reasonably straight in the cut for 2X4 and under. Probably not for precise work, the metal seems to have flex in it and it doesn't follow a speed square well.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Not the same quality as before?
customer_reviews.text: I have always had very good service out of porter cable tools. I purchased a new circular saw and the motor burned out after a few months. customer_reviews.title: Exhaust Vent badly positioned
customer_reviews.text: Just out of the box today. First, very difficult to install the blade. Tried a practice cut on 1/2" MDF - the exhaust vent is positioned so that it sprays the user with high velocity sawdust. Thought there must be some kind of plastic deflector in the box, but no such luck. Can't believe it's designed this way. I will have to make one out of plastic or aluminum or wear a head to toe protective suite.
customer_reviews.author: Peter G. Powell

customer_reviews.title: All the power I except in a cordless saw.
customer_reviews.text: Okay, I have a cordless saw made by another company (the name has no place here). That cordless saw lacked the power to preform half of the tasks I needed. As I already had Porter Cable batteries from other tools I had aquired it seemed a likely solution to my cordless saw needs. I couldn't be happier with that decision. This Porter Cable saw has all the power I require, cuts straight. I would recommend whole heatedly.

customer_reviews.title: Guide is 1/4" out of alignment with blade.
customer_reviews.text: As stated on other reviews of this saw, the guide lines do NOT line up correctly with the blade, AT ALL! They are approximately 1/4" or 5-6mm off of alignment, so it makes it VERY difficult to hand cut with this saw on a drawn cut line. This is such a stupid little thing, but very irritating for anyone using the saw by hand. This is the worst tool of the Porter-Cable line-up. Very happy with the others.

customer_reviews.title: Left me regretful

Then to add insult to injury, after 12-15 rips per battery, it drained the entire battery. I'm regretting the buy!!!

product_meta.title: PORTER-CABLE 20V MAX 6-1/2-Inch Cordless Circular Saw, Tool Only (PCC660B)
product_meta.description: The PORTER-CABLE PCC660B 20V Max Lithium Bare 6-1/2" Circular Saw features a high-performance motor delivers 4000 RPM's for aggressive cutting. It has a 6-1/2" carbide tooth blade which delivers a 2-1/8' cutting capacity for a variety of cutting applications. The beveling shoe pivots up to 50 degrees for non-traditional cutting applications. This saw also offers a contoured over molded handle optimized for increased user comfort. This compact saw helps reduce jobsite fatigue as it weighs in at only 6.5 lbs. This unit is a part of the 20V Max System; a high performance cordless platform! (This is a bare-tool item - battery sold separately).
